data.title: Good, but too spicy for kids
data.text:
Very nice and friendly staff. 
I ate here with my 5 yr old daughter and 11 yr old son. Both ordered kids meals.
The chicken which my daughter got, she only ate one bit off then downed half her drink b/c of the spice. I too had the chicken and I got instant heartburn. My lips are still a bit numb. Ingredients are fresh though.
My son got the pork and he said it was spicier than the chicken.

data.title: Chinsy
data.text: Stopped in for a snack and split a 3 taco plate with my husband since you couldn't get just a single taco. Chose the beef and received about a tablespoon of ground beef in each taco. The cheese was about a teaspoons worth. They give you chips with the plate but no salsa or anything for them. $7.50 for 3 tacos and if you wanted extra meat it was another $2.00. Also, they weren't very busy, but they had dirty tables and floor. Probably won't be back anytime soon.

data.title: Taco Bell is fresher
data.text: We went for a late lunch. Restaurant is a take off on Moes but not near as good or fresh. As we arrived my buddy noticed some of the food sitting in the hot food trough had crust, but we decided to try it anyway and pushed through. I wish I had taken it as a warning as the food tasted like it had been sitting there since the night before.

data.title: Quick Lunch, but plenty to Eat!
data.text: Great Tex Mex fast food restaurant. The food is very fresh and the service was great. I was impressed by the amount of food you get. Will go back again!

data.title: Veggie Bowl
data.text: I enjoyed my lunch. The veggie bowl was very good. However, it was a little heavy on the rice. Next time, I'll request more beans than rice. Service was fast and friendly.

data.title: Nothing special.  Not bad but.....
data.text: I had hoped it was a new Mexican place but it was just another burrito joint.  Between my personal favorite, Barberitos, Willy's and Moes not sure that Athens needs another one.  Took my wife, daughter and daughter's friend.  We all agreed it was not unpleasant or bad, just prefer other places.  Maybe once they get well established I can change my mind.

data.title: Another southwest option...
data.text: Similar to Chipotle and Moe's, this new place is great with options to choose and satisfy your southwest cravings.  I liked the cilantro-lime white rice, your pick of black or pinto beans, pick of meats (or combo thereof), and other additions.  Enough food for a good price.  Will return...and soon.  Try the saddle bar stool when you visit. Kids love it!

data.title: So so good!
data.text: I visited here with my family and it was so delicious! My family and I love Mexican food and were burned out on the standard Mexican fare we were used to having. Based on a friends recommendation we thought we'd give this place a try. Boy am I glad we did...it was so good and tasted so fresh. It's setup like Subway, essentially you walk down the line and tell them what you want in your bowl, in a salad or on a burrito.  Unlimited chips and salsa too.  Prices were very good for the amount of food you receive. We will definitely be back!

data.title: good food for a reasonable price
data.text: The food was very good and the service staff was kind and warm.  IT was cafeteria style which I was not expecting but the food was very good and it was reasonable priced . The line was not too long for the time of day(Sunday lunch) and I very much enjoyed it.

data.title: Excellent Tasty food!
data.text: This is not a sitdown restaurant. It is a hot food line type. Food is fresh, place feels clean (it is a new restaurant). It is the same type of restaurant like Barberitos or Moes. Their signature sauce is phenomenal!

data.title: Surprisingly wonderful
data.text: I went with a friend. We both figured this would be just another typical fast mex/burrito experience. We were delightfully surprised. The service was great. The food was excellent.

data.title: Worth visiting :)
data.text:
I'm not really sure when this place opened but I'm pretty sure it's early this year. I was lucky to win a gift card, honestly with the resto's name, this will not be M & I's first choice of resto :D

Anyway, we are lazy to cook lunch so we decided to use the $25 gift card today. I actually thought that it's a sitdown resto, instead you have to fall in line and give your order. I was not disappointed because I like that I can ask the server what they have and get my food right away.

You have a choice of burrito, 3 tacos, burrito bowl, salad or nachos. You have to choose the meat you want, they have steak, chicken, pork and ground/chopped beef. They also have tofu and veggie option. And then the rest of the toppings. I ordered a salad with black beans, steak, picadillo, olives, fresh jalapeños, lettuce, cheese and spicy salsa ($7.45). M ordered chicken burrito ($7.45) (see picture) not sure what's inside :) and I ordered a nacho plate with pork meat, lettuce, jalapeños, different kinds of cheese, spicy sour cream (really yummy!)($7.45) and a cup of guacamole, for an extra charge of $3+, it's a lot so we brought the leftover guacamole home too and we got 2 regular drinks for $1.85 each. Needless to say I used all of the $25 limit and pay the excess of $7.69 :D

That explains why we have to get a to go box for M's burrito, we were so FULL! :) All orders comes with a serving of nachos. I am not sure if I am crazy about the nacho chips, they are thin, so when they poured the cheese sauce they got saggy and they break easily (guess that was my fault :)) 

The service is quite slow, which is understandable, cause it's a new place and I guess some of the customers are not familiar on how to order. I think the crew on the counter are still learning the process too, the cashier seem to not know the menu yet, but I understand that, like I said it's a new place :)

It can sit probably about 30-40 people. There is the "best seat in the house" which M wanted to try but, we were too hungry to goof around :) look for that seat :) 

The Manager (which I think is actually the owner) is very friendly and interacts with the customers. He is hands on, when the soda machine had some issues, he immediately addressed and tried to fix it. 

Oh, btw, don't worry about getting extra salsa cause they have a station for individually packed salsas (green & red, mild & spicy).

I recommend this place for those that wants to get their money's worth. For $10, you will have a complete meal. The location is perfect if you want to shop, see a movie and then eat! :) it is conveniently located at the new shopping place at the Oconee Connector. Enjoy!!

data.title: Southwest food prepared before your eyes
data.text: We stopped for lunch at Diablo's hoping for a new Mexican restaurant in the shopping center.  Food was good although we had expected  to order off a menu rather than from a hot food line.  The food was good and matched the food available at similar chain restaurants serving made to order tacos, burritos and the like.  The restaurant was very clean.  Patio dining is available.  A manager was making rounds at tables checking on customer satisfaction.  We will go back.

data.title: Fresh tasting burritos
data.text: This just opened a week ago so it is busy with folks trying it out.  I had a ground beef burrito and my wife had a veggie burrito.  They have lots of ingredients to add to you burrito or bowl etc.  They build the burrito as you go down the line and you tell them which things to add.  They had some things other burrito places do not have such as cooked onions and peppers.  Then you carry you food to a table.  There is self serve drinks and salsa bar.  Everything was very fresh tasting.
